Foundation Repair

Professional Foundation Repair & Structural Solutions

Comprehensive foundation repair services in Toronto. From crack repairs to full foundation restoration. 25+ years experience, lifetime warranty. Free inspection - (437) 545-0067

Licensed & Insured

25+ Years Experience

Same Day Service

Lifetime Warranty

Our Foundation Repair Services

DrySpace Waterproofing offers comprehensive foundation repair solutions tailored to Toronto's unique challenges. Our expert team has been protecting homes and businesses for over 25 years.

Crack Injection

Professional polyurethane and epoxy injection for foundation cracks

Wall Reinforcement

Carbon fiber and steel solutions for bowing or leaning walls

Underpinning

Strengthen foundations by extending to more stable soil layers

Waterproofing

Comprehensive moisture management to protect your foundation

Common Foundation Problems in Toronto

Toronto's unique soil conditions and climate create specific foundation challenges:

  • Clay Soil Movement - Toronto's clay soil expands and contracts dramatically with moisture changes, causing foundation movement
  • Freeze-Thaw Cycles - Our harsh winters create repeated freezing and thawing that cracks concrete
  • High Water Tables - Many Toronto neighborhoods have water tables that put constant pressure on foundations
  • Age-Related Deterioration - Many Toronto homes are 50+ years old with foundations needing attention

Our Proven Foundation Repair Process

We follow a systematic approach to ensure lasting repairs:

1. Comprehensive Inspection

Our certified inspectors examine your entire foundation, identifying all issues and their root causes. We use advanced tools including laser levels and moisture meters.

2. Custom Solution Design

Every foundation is unique. We design a repair plan specific to your home's needs, considering soil conditions, damage extent, and your budget.

3. Professional Installation

Our experienced crews execute repairs with precision, using industry-leading materials and techniques. We minimize disruption to your daily life.

4. Quality Verification

Post-repair inspection ensures all work meets our high standards. We test repairs thoroughly before considering the job complete.

5. Lifetime Warranty

We stand behind our work with Toronto's most comprehensive warranty, giving you lasting peace of mind.

Warning Signs You Need Foundation Repair

Interior Warning Signs

  • Cracks in drywall or plaster
  • Doors and windows that stick or won't close
  • Uneven or sloping floors
  • Gaps between walls and floors/ceilings
  • Nail pops in drywall

Exterior Warning Signs

  • Stair-step cracks in brick or block
  • Separation between walls and chimney
  • Gaps around windows and doors
  • Bulging or bowing walls
  • Pooling water near foundation

Basement Warning Signs

  • Horizontal or vertical wall cracks
  • Water seepage or dampness
  • White powdery deposits (efflorescence)
  • Musty odors
  • Visible mold growth

Advanced Foundation Repair Methods

Crack Injection Systems

For foundation cracks, we use state-of-the-art injection systems:

  • Polyurethane Injection - Flexible seal for active leaks and moving cracks
  • Epoxy Injection - Structural repair that restores concrete strength
  • Crystalline Technology - Self-healing concrete treatment for hairline cracks

Structural Reinforcement

For more serious structural issues:

  • Carbon Fiber Straps - High-strength reinforcement for bowing walls
  • Steel I-Beams - Maximum support for severely compromised walls
  • Wall Anchors - Stabilize and potentially straighten leaning walls

Foundation Underpinning

When foundations need to be strengthened or lowered:

  • Mini-Pile System - Steel piles driven to bedrock for ultimate stability
  • Concrete Underpinning - Traditional method for extending foundation depth
  • Resin Injection - Modern soil stabilization technique

Foundation Repair Cost Factors

Understanding what affects repair costs helps you budget appropriately:

Primary Cost Factors

  • Damage Extent - Minor cracks cost less than major structural issues
  • Repair Method - Simple injections vs. complex underpinning
  • Foundation Type - Block, poured concrete, or stone foundations
  • Accessibility - Easy access reduces labor costs
  • Soil Conditions - Challenging soil may require additional work

Additional Considerations

  • Permits - Major repairs require city permits
  • Landscaping - Restoration after exterior work
  • Interior Finishing - Drywall repair after interior work
  • Waterproofing - Often recommended with repairs

24/7 Emergency Foundation Repair

Foundation emergencies don't wait for business hours. When you discover:

  • Sudden severe cracking
  • Wall movement or bulging
  • Major water intrusion
  • Structural instability

Call our emergency line immediately: (437) 545-0067

Our emergency response team is available 24/7 to stabilize your foundation and prevent further damage.
